content: peachy keen baby hat by chloë rip of true north yarn co size to fit an average newborn size up by casting on 10 stitches more making hat 1 - 2 inches taller size down by casting on 10 stitches less materials 4 ply/ fingering/ sock weight yarn i used 15g 74yds of sirdar snuggly baby crofter 4ply in shade 194 jocelyn this and many other 4ply options can be purchased online at www truenorthyarn com 3 00mm/us2 5 needle for gauge of 28 stitches to 4 /10cm seamed version is worked back and forth flat so you can use straight needles or work back and forth on any circular needle seamless version is worked in the round - use a 32 or 40 circular for magic loop or 9 circular 12 circular and/or dpns for more traditional circular knitting seamed version cast on 81 stitches or 91 for larger size row 1 k1 p1 … repeat k1 p1 ribbing to last stitch k1 row 2 p1 k1 … repeat p1 k1 ribbing to last stitch p1 repeat row 1 & 2 until ribbing measures 3 25 from cast on or to desired length depending on if you want to fold it up or not for a smaller brim that won t be folded up i recommend 1 row 3 knit all stitches row 4 purl all stitches repeat row 3 & 4 until plain stockinette measures 2 25 - 2 50 from end of ribbing hat measures 5 5 from cast on for fold-over band version or 3 5 from cast on for non-folded 1 ribbed brim version row 5 *k8 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 73 stitches row 6 purl all stitches row 7 knit all stitches row 8 purl all stitches row 9 *k7 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 65 stitches row 10 purl all stitches row 11 *k6 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 57 stitches row 12 purl all stitches row 13 *k5 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 49 stitches row 14 purl all stitches row 15 *k4 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 41 stitches row 16 purl all stitches row 17 *k3 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 33 stitches row 18 purl all stitches row 19 *k2 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 25 stitches row 20 purl all stitches row 21 *k1 k2tog* repeat to last stitch k1 17 stitches row 22 p1 p2tog eight times 9 stitches cut yarn leaving a 10 tail using darning needle thread tail through remaining live stitches and draw tight use remaining tail to seam hat weave in ends seamless version cast on 80 stitches row 1 k1 p1 … repeat k1 p1 ribbing all the way around continue ribbing until hat measures 3 25 from cast on or to desired length depending on if you want to fold it up or not for a smaller brim that won t be folded up i recommend 1 from cast on row 2 knit
